description: This notification is sent when EIGRP MD5 authentication
is enabled on any interface and peer adjacencies are
formed, and any adjacencies go down as a result of an
authentication failure.

event.Summary: EIGRP MD5 authentication failed with peer $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpAuthFailureEvent CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddrType i 0 CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddr s EXAMPLE

description: The format of the remote source IP address used by the
peer to establish the EIGRP adjacency with this router.
variables.name: CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddrType

description: The source IP address used by the peer to establish the
EIGRP adjacency with this router. The format is
governed by object cEigrpPeerAddrType.
variables.name: CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddr

description: This notification is sent when a route in the topology
table is stuck in an active state. During the query
phase for a new route to a destination network, a route
is described as being in the active state if when an
alternate path is actively being sought, no replies are
received to normal queries or stuck-in-active queries.

Summary.eval: ($v3==1) ? 'EIGRP route stuck in active for $v2' : 'EIGRP route not stuck in active state'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpRouteStuckInActive CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddrType i 0 CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddr s EXAMPLE CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpStuckInActive i 1

description: The format of the remote source IP address used by the
peer to establish the EIGRP adjacency with this router.
variables.name: CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddrType

description: The source IP address used by the peer to establish the
EIGRP adjacency with this router. The format is
governed by object cEigrpPeerAddrType.
variables.name: CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddr

description: A value of true(1) indicates that that this route which is
in active state (cEigrpActive = true(1)) has not received
any replies to queries for alternate paths, and a second
EIGRP route query, called a stuck-in-active query, has
now been sent.
variables.name: CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpStuckInActive

description: This notification is sent when any EIGRP peer adjacency goes
down.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpNbrDownEvent CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddrType i 0 CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddr s EXAMPLE

description: The format of the remote source IP address used by the
peer to establish the EIGRP adjacency with this router.
variables.name: CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddrType

description: The source IP address used by the peer to establish the
EIGRP adjacency with this router. The format is
governed by object cEigrpPeerAddrType.
variables.name: CISCO-EIGRP-MIB::cEigrpPeerAddr
